entities

Class Enemy

  • java.lang.Object
    • city.cs.engine.Body
      • city.cs.engine.DynamicBody
        • city.cs.engine.Walker
          • entities.Enemy
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Demon, Ghost, Hound, Skeleton

    public class Enemy
extends city.cs.engine.Walker
    Abstract representation of an enemy character in the game. The enemy has the ability to patrol between two boundaries and change direction upon reaching them. Upon death, a death animation is triggered.
    Since:
    1.0

      Constructs an Enemy with defined boundaries for patrolling and images for display.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void enemyDie()
      Triggers the enemy's death sequence, creating a death animation at the enemy's position and removing the enemy from the world.
      void patrol()
      Controls the enemy's patrolling behavior, making it move left and right between its boundaries.
      private void updateImage()
      Updates the enemy's image based on the current direction of movement.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Enemy

        public Enemy(city.cs.engine.World world,
             city.cs.engine.Shape shape,
             city.cs.engine.BodyImage imageRight,
             city.cs.engine.BodyImage imageLeft,
             int leftBoundary,
             int rightBoundary,
             int walkingSpeed)
        Constructs an Enemy with defined boundaries for patrolling and images for display.
        Parameters:
        world - The world this enemy belongs to.
        shape - The physical shape of the enemy.
        imageRight - The image to display when the enemy moves to the right.
        imageLeft - The image to display when the enemy moves to the left.
        leftBoundary - The left boundary of the enemy's patrol area.
        rightBoundary - The right boundary of the enemy's patrol area.
        walkingSpeed - The speed at which the enemy patrols.

    • Method Detail

      • patrol

        public void patrol()
        Controls the enemy's patrolling behavior, making it move left and right between its boundaries.

      • updateImage

        private void updateImage()
        Updates the enemy's image based on the current direction of movement.

      • enemyDie

        public void enemyDie()
        Triggers the enemy's death sequence, creating a death animation at the enemy's position and removing the enemy from the world.
